title: The millions being made from cardboard theft
description: With the global market for recycled cardboard worth billions of dollars, it is attracting criminals.

title: 'Why I stopped hiding my scars'
description: Jayne, Emily, Laura and Aimee talk about their scars, and how they came to accept them.

title: What Europe's cities are doing to handle heatwaves
description: As London swelters, we look at how urban areas can adapt to deal with higher temperatures.

title: UK heatwave: Severe storms forecast after scorching temperatures
description: Flooding, damage to buildings, travel disruption and power cuts are expected in several regions.

title: PSG score twice in stoppage time to shatter Atalanta and reach semi-finals
description: Paris St-Germain reach the semi-finals of the Champions League for the first time in 25 years with two stoppage-time goals against Atalanta.

title: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris say Trump has left US 'in tatters'
description: Joe Biden formally introduces Kamala Harris as his vice-presidential pick in Delaware.

title: Three dead after passenger train derails near Stonehaven
description: The driver, a conductor and a passenger were killed in the incident in Aberdeenshire.

title: Fluent O'Sullivan leads battling Selby in Crucible semi-final
description: Ronnie O'Sullivan earns a 5-3 lead against a battling Mark Selby in the World Championship semi-final.

title: Rangers ease St Johnstone aside to go top of Scottish Premiership
description: Rangers move to the top of the Scottish Premiership on goal difference with a clinical win over St Johnstone.

title: Coronavirus: England death count review reduces UK toll by 5,000
description: Deaths recorded in England had included people who tested positive months before they died.

title: Coronavirus in Europe: Infections surge in France, Germany and Spain
description: Germany and Greece record their highest daily cases, while Spain and France reach a "tipping point".

title: Exam results: 'Mocks aren't a fair way to decide grades'
description: A-level student Mia Cleal-Bramley explains why she doesn't want to rely on her mock exam results.

title: Williamson apologises for school and exam disruption
description: England's Education Secretary Gavin Williamson tells children he is 'incredibly sorry' they have suffered.

title: Firefighter fosters Jack Russell dog he saved from flames
description: Millie the Jack Russell was found apparently "lifeless" beneath a bed in a ground floor flat.

title: Torrential rain and thunderstorms bring flooding and disruption
description: A major incident is declared in Fife after storms caused flooding and disruption.

title: Beirut blast: The other countries with dangerous dumps of explosives
description: The blast in Beirut is a reminder that tonnes of dangerous materials are being stored in several countries.

title: Lindsay Birbeck: Teenager guilty of murdering teaching assistant
description: The 17-year-old boy killed Lindsay Birbeck before moving her body in a bin and burying her.

title: Middlemarch and other works by women reissued under their real names
description: By George? Not anymore thanks to the 25 titles in the newly released Reclaim Her Name library.

title: Coronavirus: England's contact-tracing app gets green light for trial
description: Public tests are set to start on Thursday, but concerns remain about how accurately distance is measured.

title: BBC to show Women's Community Shield between Chelsea & Man City
description: The BBC will show live coverage of the Women's Community Shield between Chelsea and Manchester City at Wembley on 29 August.

title: Recession is unprecedented, says Chancellor Rishi Sunak
description: Rishi Sunak says it is a "difficult and uncertain time" as the UK suffers its biggest slump on record.

title: 'Hundreds dead' because of Covid-19 misinformation
description: A study says at least 800 people have died globally because of coronavirus-related misinformation.

title: George Michael: Nine-metre mural to be unveiled in London
description: The artwork will be unveiled in Brent in September.

title: Wiegman preferred choice to replace Neville as England women's boss
description: Netherlands women's manager Sarina Wiegman is the FA's preferred choice to succeed Phil Neville as England's head coach.

title: Why are there so few black and minority ethnic sporting statues?
description: Of 240 statues of athletes in the UK, only 10 are of black or ethnic minority sportsmen or women - BBC Sport asks why.

title: BBC Women's Sport Survey: Periods, the pill and the effect on female athletes
description: Female athletes discuss how periods, contraceptive pills and the coil can impact their performance in unexpected ways.

title: Coronavirus: France's champagne industry goes flat amid pandemic
description: The coronavirus pandemic has led to plummeting demand - leaving growers and producers at loggerheads.
